timeline.bodyText:
It's unclear at first glance where "stream1" and "someField" come from.
I'd suggest either declaring them in variables at the start of test and passing them down or extracting them from the messageList object.
timeline.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: I decided to pass them to the method generating the message list, so they are close to the assertion.
replies.author: dennisoelkers

timeline.bodyText: Pass in allFieldTypes directly instead of both the context and the stream IDs.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText:
I'd suggest pushing the null check down to ESGeneratedQueryContext or even FieldTypesLookup.
I even think all of the logic in this method could be pushed down to FieldTypesLookup. Instead of asking for all field types for these streams, ask explicitly for the type of the field, i.e., FieldTypesLookup#getType(String fieldName, Set<String> streamIds). That would encapsulate all this stuff in FieldTypesLookup and this method could be replaced with: queryContext.getFieldType(sort.field(), effectiveStreamIds)
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: This and the next test would become obsolete, if you followed my suggestion above to move that logic into FieldTypeLookup. I would add a few simpler unit tests for FieldTypesLookup instead.
timeline.author: alex-konn
